question: The term Hague Code of Conduct (HCoC), sometimes seen in news, is related to which of the following?
option1: To ensure that the rights of refugees are protected globally
option2: To prevent the easy proliferation of ballistic missiles
answer: To prevent the easy proliferation of ballistic missiles
explanation: The International Code of Conduct against Ballistic Missile Proliferation is also known as the Hague Code of Conduct. It was established on 25 November 2002. As of January 2018, 139 countries have joined the HCoC. India joined the Hague Code of Conduct against Ballistic Missile Proliferation (HCoC) on 1 June 2017. It has also agreed to submit an annual declaration of policy on satellite launch vehicles and ballistic missiles.
